It most certainly could be, I have very little desire to put that together though.  The easiest thing for you to do is just make your own initializer that overwrites the store's getter and setter methods:

    module ActiveRecord
      module Store
        module ClassMethods
          def store_accessor(store_attribute, *keys)
            Array(keys).flatten.each do |key|
              define_method("#{store_attribute}_#{key}=") do |value|
                send(store_attribute)[key] = value
              end

              define_method("#{store_attribute}_#{key}") do
                send(store_attribute)[key]
              end
            end
          end
        end
      end
    end

This for example will make it so that the column name is the prefix...  Probably what it should be doing as default behavior in my opinion.
